sense.name: the scent or odor of something
sense.examples: We awoke to the smell of hot coffee and frying bacon. He liked the lingering smell of her hair on his pillow. These dogs are trained to identify different chemical smells.

sense.name: a bad or unpleasant odor
sense.commentary: SMELL[+quality][+property][+odor][+bad] Note: a narrow, pejorative usage of Sense 1
sense.examples: Twenty seven cats lived in the apartment, so you can imagine the smell. They left the hotel after one night because of the smells.

sense.name: general atmosphere of a situation
sense.examples: The whole business proposition has a funny smell about it. The act has the smell of treason. Mary's life has the smell of excitement.

sense.name: the sense faculty of odor detection
sense.examples: Dogs have a far better sense of smell than humans do. The sharks find the bloody chum by smell. The spray confuses the insects' smell sensors.

sense.name: the act of perceiving a scent
sense.examples: Mary bent over the rose bush to have a smell. The head chef took a smell of the sauce and corrected the seasoning.
